description.narrative:
Introduction of the project: statement of objectives and planned outcomes Uganda Environment Education Foundation (UEEF) is an indigenous non-governmental Organisation founded in 1997 and is currently registered with the Uganda NGO board. UEEF works with civil society organisations, schools, farmers, local governments and diverse local community groups. UEEF has worked on various projects that include research, advocacy and livelihood improvement. UEEF provides its services across a large scope of environmental subject matter including: renewable energy, water and sanitation, agriculture and rural development. UEEF is committed to improving livelihoods through provision of quality environmental education and advocacy and promotion of sustainable agriculture and sanitation.
UEEF was tasked by the Climate Action Network Uganda (CAN-U) Executive Committee to implement the capacity building project on adaptationfinance including additional outreach activities such as national dialogue meetings, COP20 finance thematic group, and raising awareness on climate change and adaptation. UEEF will work with other CAN-U member organisations to implement the project.
It has been recognised that whereas there is increased funding towards adaptation generally, there still remains a huge challenge of accountability and transparency at different levels of governance in the country. It is also recognised that civil society can play a big role of oversight over government and other mandated institutions in ensuring that adaptation finance reaches the most vulnerable. However, the CSOs do not have adequate capacity to do a comprehensive undertaking. Therefore, this project will help to build a strong base of civil society institutions that can reinforce accountability and transparency in climate finance in Uganda.
Overall aim of theproject The project aims to strengthen the capacity of Ugandan civil society organisations to promote accountability and transparency in regard to adaptation finance through targeted trainings.
Specific objectives of this project include: # To build capacity of CSOs in tracking/monitoring adaptation finance at national and sub national level # To mainstream gender in climate change adaptation finance # To influence the Ugandan position on climate finance for the COP20 in Lima Peru to specifically shape the global adaptation finance mechanisms # To influence national policy makers on transparency and accountability in regard to climate finance
The outcomes of this project arebased on the overall project outcomes that include:

participating-org.narrative: Uganda Environment Education Foundation (UEEF) is an indigenous non-governmental organization (NGO) founded in 1997 by a group of professional environmentalists and is currently registered by the National NGO Board. UEEF has worked with more than 130,000diverse and dedicated beneficiaries for the last 13 years and these include schools, farmers, local governments, other Non Governmental Organisations and grass root community individuals throughout Mukono District and other parts of Uganda. UEEF has embarked on a number ofresearch projects in collaboration with other NGOs whose results substantially contributed to major policy decisions made by the country, regarding environmental protection/conservation. UEEF head offices are currently located in Mukonotown. UEEF uses a range of proven methodologies and practical tools, based on indigenous knowledge and participatory approaches. UEEF provides its services across a large scope of environmental subject matter including, renewable energy, water <(>&<)> sanitation, agriculture and rural development. UEEF recently embarked on a rigorous 360# organization wide assessment exercise which involved a comprehensive assessment ofUEEF by its donor partners, its peers, its beneficiaries, and itself. This assessment andcritical review led to the adoption of theorganization#s vision, mission and strategic goals in its strategic plan for the next 5 years (2010 # 2014). The adopted strategic plan underscores UEEF#s precedence of being committed to improving livelihoods through provision of quality environmental education <(>&<)> advocacy and promotion of sustainable agricultural and sanitation practices.
